thread.title: ODU defeats No. 5 U.Va. in field hockey
thread.title_full: ODU defeats No. 5 U.Va. in field hockey | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: ODU defeats No. 5 U.Va. in field hockey
text:
NORFOLK Junior Casey Dolan connected on a corner during double-overtime to lift 15th-ranked Old Dominion to a 3-2 win over No. 5 Virginia in a non-conference field hockey game Sunday.
Old Dominion (8-3) notched its fifth win over a ranked opponent this season.
Along with Dolan, senior Teisha King and freshman Bailey Quinn notched goals for ODU.
The Lady Monarchs dominated the overtime periods, recording eight shots to two for U.Va. (10-3). ODU was also awarded four penalty corners, with the last one setting up Dolan's game winner.
The Lady Monarchs host No. 8 Maryland at 5 p.m. Wednesday.
-- Virginia Wesleyan defeated Wells 3-0 in a game at Ferrum College. Ashley Parker (Western Branch High), Taylor Marshall and Missy Stroup scored for VWC, which won its second in a row. The Marlins (4-9) host Randolph-Macon on Wednesday in an ODAC game.
